key_points: Facebook estimated to have lost roughly $99.75 million in revenue due to an outage on Monday.
Outage lasted from approximately 11:30 a.m. ET to just after 7 p.m. ET, impacting Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger.
Loss calculated based on Facebook's Q2 earnings, averaging $319.6 million per day or $13.3 million per hour.
The financial loss for Facebook represents a minor impact in the context of its overall revenues.
Facebook's stock fell about 4.9% following a whistleblower report accusing the company of choosing 'profit over safety'.
Former product manager Frances Haugen revealed herself as the whistleblower in a 60 Minutes interview.
Haugen leaked internal Facebook research to the Wall Street Journal and lawmakers.
She claimed Facebook deactivated safeguards against misinformation and offensive content after the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
Haugen linked the decision to deactivate these safeguards to the Jan. 6 Capitol Riots.
Facebook has minimized the significance of the leaked documents.
spokespersons: Frances Haugen (former product manager at Facebook)
